resources.string: This is for Advanced Users.\n\nAdjusting these options may completely change how %1$s performs, proceed at your own risk. Many users will NOT need to change these settings.

This is for Advanced Users.

You can adjust the performance and resource usage of the %1$s Hotspot, which will adjust the number of virtual threads allocated to the Hotspot Network.

More Threads will result in usually faster performance, but higher battery usage and may heat up or slow down your device.
Unlimited threads. Offers maximum performance. Throws battery usage concerns out the window.
%1$d threads. Uses the least battery but offers the slowest hotspot performance.
%1$d threads. Uses less battery but offers slower hotspot performance.
%1$d threads. Offers a balance between battery usage and hotspot performance.
%1$d threads. Offers better hotspot performance at the cost of more battery usage.
%1$d threads. Offers great hotspot performance at the cost of significant battery usage.

This is for Advanced Users.\n\nYou can adjust the timeout, which controls how long %1$s will wait for a connection before closing a socket. For most well behaving, modern websites on a decent connection, you should be fine with the default. If you notice connections are reporting frequent time outs, you should try increasing this value. If you notice high latency, you could try lowering the value

Will never close connections until the website closes them. Throws memory usage and latency concerns out the window in an attempt to get websites to work. If there are many connections, could massively increase latency and memory usage. Adjusting Power Balance for Max or High performance is recommended.
Barely waits at all. If you are on a fast connection, most well-behaved websites should still work. Cleans up aggressively, lowering memory usage and latency at the risk of breaking connections
Slightly faster timeout that should work with most well-behaved websites. Slightly lower memory usage, and only some latency if there are many connections.
The most balanced setting that should work with most well-behaved websites. Normal memory usage, and only some latency if there are many connections.

Waits extra long which should allow slower or bad behaving websites to still work. Slightly higher memory usage and latency if there are many connections. Adjusting Power Balance for High performance is recommended.
Almost every website should work. If there are many connections, could massively increase latency and memory usage. Adjusting Power Balance for Max or High performance is recommended.
